wikipedia_page.main: Sir Molyneux Hyde Nepean, 2nd Baronet (20 September 1783 in England – 4 June 1856 at Hexham, Northumberland) was an English first-class cricketer associated with Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC).

response: Barton Wright married Janet Forlonge in 1858, whilst on leave in England. She was the daughter of William Forlonge, a pastoralist and politician in colonial Victoria and New South Wales, and grand-daughter of the Australian pioneer breeder of Merino sheep, Eliza Forlonge. They had six sons and three daughters. His third son Edward William Barton-Wright was a pioneering promoter of Asian martial arts in the Western world: see Bartitsu. His sister, Lydia, married Sir Molyneux Nepean, 2nd Baronet, of Mapperton House, of Loder’s Court, of Bothenhampton, Dorset, and of Lee Hall, Northumberland.
